intro: Dienia muscifera, commonly known as the musk vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Bignoniaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with slender stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its showy, fragrant flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive musk-like scent. Dienia muscifera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
